english_translation: Narrated by Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad: Hudhayfah asked Salman: 'Should we not build a dwelling for you, O Abu Abdillah?' Salman replied: 'Why? Will you make me a king or build for me something like your house in Ctesiphon?' Hudhayfah said: 'No, but we will build for you a house of reeds and roof it with straw. When you stand up, it would almost touch your head, and when you lie down, it would almost touch your feet.' Salman said: 'It is as if you knew what is in my heart.'

english_translation: Narrated from someone who heard from al-Hasan: Salman wept at his death. It was said to him: 'What makes you weep, O Abu Abdullahi?' He said: 'The Prophet ﷺ made a covenant with us and said: Indeed, it suffices one of you in this world something similar to the provisions of a traveler.' I fear that I have been negligent (in following this covenant).'

It was said: 'We have no bread.' He said: 'It does not matter. Let them eat from this bone broth and drink from this meat soup.'
